revised_title: General Structure of Condensed Monomolecular Films
tldr: The authors propose a general structure for condensed monomolecular films, suggesting that in the least compressible region, long chains are vertically orientated and close-packed, while in the more compressible region, both hydrocarbon chain packing and head-group dipole orientation determine the configuration. They discuss the physical states of monolayers and the factors influencing them, such as forces between polar head groups and hydrophobic tails.
